title: Career & Workstyle
content:
{
  "career_entry": "Entered software engineering pragmatically, later developed deep commitment",
  "professional_focus": "Systems-focused engineer rather than application-focused",
  "design_philosophy": "Prioritizes coherence, structure, and long-term maintainability",
  "problem_stance": "Pushes back on assumptions and fixes structural issues early",
  "normalization_style": "Prefers one-time normalization over repeated small fixes",
  "systemic_over_patches": "Prefers systemic fixes over incremental patches",
  "repo_wide_changes": "Willing to change entire repositories once to enforce coherence",
  "perfectionist_pause": "Pauses work via time-boxing rather than abandoning it",
  "intrinsic_motivation": "Work is intrinsically motivated; paid and personal work aligned"
}

title: Engineering Principles
content:
{
  "automation_rule": "Repeating task -> automate; one-time task -> manual",
  "automation_belief": "Refactor once, then enforce consistency through automation",
  "tooling_philosophy": "Tooling should fade after enforcement",
  "quality_criteria": [
    "Determinism",
    "Testability",
    "Repeatability",
    "Guardrails"
  ],
  "software_priorities": [
    "Testability",
    "Observability",
    "Failure resilience"
  ],
  "aesthetics_secondary": "Code aesthetics are secondary to behavior under failure",
  "decision_bias": "Default stance is no unless necessity is clear",
  "deferred_work": "Deferred fixes must be explicitly documented; silent debt rejected",
  "learning_postdeploy": "Some bad ideas only surface after deployment"
}

title: AI Philosophy & Workflow
content:
{
  "ai_relationship": "Uses AI as a constrained system, not an autonomous authority",
  "ai_goal": "Teach AI to code better for her rather than coding better herself",
  "delegation_preference": "Delegates implementation when automation or AI is viable",
  "oversight_model": "Minimal code review; validation via running and testing behavior",
  "correction_style": "Corrects AI when it optimizes the wrong target; fixes are small and scoped",
  "edge_case_strength": "High sensitivity to edge cases and failure modes",
  "assumption_detection": "Rapidly surfaces undocumented assumptions",
  "ai_baseline_view": "AI treated as a baseline expectation, not a novelty feature",
  "supervision_posture": "Treats AI as a constrained actor; defines acceptable behavior before allowing output expansion",
  "value_hierarchy": "Correctness and traceability over fluency or charm"
}

content:

content:

}

title: Constraints & Preferences
Decision Heuristics
content:
{
  "evaluation_first": "Optimizes for external evaluation clarity over internal elegance when stakes are high",
  "constraint_driven": "Uses explicit constraints to reduce decision entropy",
  "timeboxing": "Treats timeboxing as a stop condition, not a failure",
  "stability_over_improvement": "Prioritizes stability over improvement once a system enters evaluation",
  "information_discipline": "Favors machine-readable structure as a first-class concern",
  "working_heuristics": [
    "If it can't be evaluated quickly, it won't be evaluated fairly",
    "Constraints are communication tools",
    "Stability beats cleverness under review",
    "AI should explain uncertainty, not mask it",
    "Stopping is a decision, not a lapse"
  ]
}

title: Project Selection Logic
content:
{
  "framing": "Frames projects explicitly as decision-bearing systems, not deliverables",
  "selection_basis": "Selects projects based on the signal they emit, not their completeness or polish",
  "mix_strategy": "Maintains a deliberate mix of active, experimental, and concluded work to show judgment over time",
  "failure_visibility": "Willing to keep non-showcase projects visible if they explain constraints, failures, or tradeoffs",
  "learning_vs_signaling": "Distinguishes clearly between projects meant to signal competence and those meant to generate learning"
}
